api_endpoints.name: get-/cms/v3/site-search/search_search

wrapper_tool.name: search_website_content

description.tagline: Search for website content on a HubSpot account.
description.detailed: Use this tool to retrieve website content that matches specified search criteria within a HubSpot account. Filters can include content type, domain, or URL path.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Website content matching the search criteria.

arguments.name: search_term
arguments.description: The term to search for in the HubSpot website content.

arguments.name: results_limit
arguments.description: The number of search results to return. Defaults to 10 and has a maximum of 100.

arguments.name: pagination_offset
arguments.description: Integer used to page through results. Use the offset from the previous request to access the next set of results.

arguments.name: content_language_code
arguments.description: Specifies the language of content to be searched using a valid ISO 639-1 code (e.g. 'es' for Spanish).

arguments.name: popularity_boost
arguments.description: Specify the boost factor for a result based on its view count. Defaults to 1.0.

arguments.name: maximum_boost_limit
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum amount a result will be boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 5.0.

arguments.name: boost_recent_time_window
arguments.description: A relative time window to boost scores of documents published within this period. Use '10d' for 10 days. Supported units: ms, s, m, h, d. Applicable to blog posts only.

arguments.name: hubdb_table_id
arguments.description: Specifies a specific HubDB table to search. Only results from this table are returned. Can be combined with 'hubdb_query' for further filtering.

arguments.name: hubdb_query_filter
arguments.description: Specify a HubDB query to filter search results in the specified table.

arguments.name: search_domains
arguments.description: List of domains to match search results for. Multiple domains can be included by separating them with '&'.

arguments.name: content_type_filters
arguments.description: List of content types to search, such as SITE_PAGE, LANDING_PAGE, BLOG_POST, LISTING_PAGE, and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE.

arguments.name: path_prefixes
arguments.description: An array of strings to filter search results by URL path prefix. Only returns results with paths starting with specified prefixes.

arguments.name: search_properties
arguments.description: A list of properties to include in the search. Options: `title`, `description`, `html`. By default, all properties are searched.

arguments.name: result_length
arguments.description: Specifies whether search results should be detailed (LONG) or brief (SHORT).

arguments.name: blog_ids_to_search
arguments.description: List of blog IDs to search within. Allows searching multiple blogs by their IDs.

arguments.name: invert_path_prefix_filter
arguments.description: Set to 'false' to apply the normal behavior of the pathPrefix filter; 'true' to invert it.

arguments.name: show_autocomplete
arguments.description: Specify whether autocomplete results should be shown. Defaults to false.

api_endpoints.description: Returns any website content matching the given search criteria for a given HubSpot account. Searches can be filtered by content type, domain, or URL path.

query.name: q

value_schema.description: The term to search for.

query.description: The term to search for.

query.name: limit

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of results to be returned in a single response. Defaults to `10`. Maximum value is `100`.

query.description: Specifies the number of results to be returned in a single response. Defaults to `10`. Maximum value is `100`.

query.name: offset

value_schema.description: Used to page through the results. If there are more results than specified by the `limit` parameter, you will need to use the value of offset returned in the previous request to get the next set of results.

query.description: Used to page through the results. If there are more results than specified by the `limit` parameter, you will need to use the value of offset returned in the previous request to get the next set of results.

query.name: language

value_schema.description: Specifies the language of content to be searched. This value must be a valid [ISO 639-1 language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `es` for Spanish)

query.description: Specifies the language of content to be searched. This value must be a valid [ISO 639-1 language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `es` for Spanish)

query.name: matchPrefix

value_schema.description: Inverts the behavior of the pathPrefix filter when set to `false`. Defaults to `true`.

query.description: Inverts the behavior of the pathPrefix filter when set to `false`. Defaults to `true`.

query.name: autocomplete

value_schema.description: Specifies whether or not you are showing autocomplete results. Defaults to false.

query.description: Specifies whether or not you are showing autocomplete results. Defaults to false.

query.name: popularityBoost

value_schema.description: Specifies how strongly a result is boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 1.0.

query.description: Specifies how strongly a result is boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 1.0.

query.name: boostLimit

value_schema.description: Specifies the maximum amount a result will be boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 5.0. Read more about elasticsearch boosting [here](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-boost.html).

query.description: Specifies the maximum amount a result will be boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 5.0. Read more about elasticsearch boosting [here](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-boost.html).

query.name: boostRecent

value_schema.description: Specifies a relative time window where scores of documents published outside this time window decay. This can only be used for blog posts. For example, boostRecent=10d will boost documents published within the last 10 days. Supported timeunits are ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

query.description: Specifies a relative time window where scores of documents published outside this time window decay. This can only be used for blog posts. For example, boostRecent=10d will boost documents published within the last 10 days. Supported timeunits are ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

query.name: tableId

value_schema.description: Specifies a specific HubDB table to search. Only returns results from the specified table. Can be used in tandem with the `hubdbQuery` parameter to further filter results.

query.description: Specifies a specific HubDB table to search. Only returns results from the specified table. Can be used in tandem with the `hubdbQuery` parameter to further filter results.

query.name: hubdbQuery

value_schema.description: Specify a HubDB query to further filter the search results.

query.description: Specify a HubDB query to further filter the search results.

query.name: domain

value_schema.description: A domain to match search results for. Multiple domains can be provided with &.

query.description: A domain to match search results for. Multiple domains can be provided with &.

query.name: type

value_schema.description: Specifies the type of content to search. Can be one or more of SITE_PAGE, LANDING_PAGE, BLOG_POST, LISTING_PAGE, and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE. Defaults to all content types except LANDING_PAGE and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE

query.description: Specifies the type of content to search. Can be one or more of SITE_PAGE, LANDING_PAGE, BLOG_POST, LISTING_PAGE, and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE. Defaults to all content types except LANDING_PAGE and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE

query.name: pathPrefix

value_schema.description: Specifies a path prefix to filter search results. Will only return results with URL paths that start with the specified parameter. Can be used multiple times.

query.description: Specifies a path prefix to filter search results. Will only return results with URL paths that start with the specified parameter. Can be used multiple times.

query.name: property

value_schema.description: Specifies which properties to include in the search. Options include `title`, `description`, and `html`. All properties will be searched by default.

query.description: Specifies which properties to include in the search. Options include `title`, `description`, and `html`. All properties will be searched by default.

query.name: length

value_schema.description: Specifies the length of the search results. Can be set to `LONG` or `SHORT`. `SHORT` will return the first 128 characters of the content's meta description. `LONG` will build a more detailed content snippet based on the html/content of the page.

query.description: Specifies the length of the search results. Can be set to `LONG` or `SHORT`. `SHORT` will return the first 128 characters of the content's meta description. `LONG` will build a more detailed content snippet based on the html/content of the page.

query.name: groupId

value_schema.description: Specifies which blog(s) to be searched by blog ID. Can be used multiple times to search more than one blog.

query.description: Specifies which blog(s) to be searched by blog ID. Can be used multiple times to search more than one blog.

description.detailed: This tool initiates the extraction of a zip file in the developer file system asynchronously. This is useful for handling large files or files that need processing without blocking operations. Use this tool when you need to start a zip file extraction and check its status later through the appropriate status endpoint.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Information on the initiation of the extraction process.

arguments.name: zip_file_path
arguments.description: The path to the zip file in the developer file system that needs extraction.

api_endpoints.description: Extract a zip file in the developer file system. Extraction status can be checked with the `/extract/async/tasks/taskId/status` endpoint below.

api_endpoints.name: get-/cms/v3/source-code/extract/async/tasks/{taskId}/status_getAsyncStatus

wrapper_tool.name: check_extraction_status

description.tagline: Retrieve the current status of a source-code extraction task.
description.detailed: Use this tool to check the status of a specific source-code extraction by providing the `taskId`. It's useful for tracking the progress of an extraction after initiating it with the `extract/async` request.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: The status of the extraction task.

arguments.name: extraction_task_id
arguments.description: The unique ID of the extraction task, obtained from the initial `extract/async` request. This ID is required to check the status of the extraction.

api_endpoints.description: Get the status of an extraction by the `taskId` returned from the initial `extract/async` request.

path.name: taskId

value_schema.description: The extraction task ID returned by the initial `extract/async` request.

path.description: The extraction task ID returned by the initial `extract/async` request.

api_endpoints.name: post-/cms/v3/blogs/tags/batch/update_updateBatch

wrapper_tool.name: update_blog_tags

description.tagline: Update multiple blog tags in HubSpot CMS.
description.detailed: Use this tool to update blog tag objects identified in the request body within the HubSpot CMS. It is useful for bulk modifications of blog tags.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details about the updated blog tags.

arguments.name: blog_tags_update_data
arguments.description: A JSON array representing the updated Blog Tags. Include all necessary fields for each tag.

arguments.name: update_deleted_blog_tags
arguments.description: Specifies whether to update deleted blog tags. Defaults to false.

api_endpoints.summary: Update a batch of Blog Tags
api_endpoints.description: Update the Blog Tag objects identified in the request body.

query.name: archived

query.description: Specifies whether to update deleted Blog Tags. Defaults to `false`.

body.name: requestBody

value_schema.description: A JSON array of the JSON representations of the updated Blog Tags.

body.description: A JSON array of the JSON representations of the updated Blog Tags.

json_schema.description: Wrapper for providing an array of JSON nodes as inputs.

description.tagline: Archive multiple blog tags in HubSpot CMS.
description.detailed: Use this tool to delete multiple blog tag objects in HubSpot CMS by providing their identifiers. Suitable for cleaning up unused or obsolete tags in batches.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of blog tags deletion.

arguments.name: blog_tag_identifiers
arguments.description: An array of strings representing the blog tag identifiers to be archived.

api_endpoints.summary: Delete a batch of Blog Tags
api_endpoints.description: Delete the Blog Tag objects identified in the request body.

body.name: inputs

value_schema.description: Strings to input.

body.description: Strings to input.

json_schema.description: Strings to input.

api_endpoints.name: put-/cms/v3/blogs/tags/multi-language/set-new-lang-primary_setLangPrimary

wrapper_tool.name: set_blog_tag_primary_language

description.tagline: Set a blog tag as the primary language in a multi-language group.
description.detailed: This tool updates a blog tag to be the primary language within a multi-language group, ensuring content consistency across different languages.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of blog tag primary language update.

arguments.name: primary_language_tag_id
arguments.description: ID of the blog tag to set as the primary language in a multi-language group.

api_endpoints.description: Set a Blog Tag as the primary language of a multi-language group.

body.name: id

value_schema.description: ID of object to set as primary in multi-language group.

body.description: ID of object to set as primary in multi-language group.

json_schema.description: ID of object to set as primary in multi-language group.

api_endpoints.name: post-/cms/v3/blogs/tags/batch/read_readBatch

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_blog_tags

description.tagline: Retrieve Blog Tag objects based on specified IDs.
description.detailed: This tool retrieves detailed information about specific Blog Tag objects in HubSpot CMS, identified by the IDs provided in the request.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of the requested Blog Tag objects.

arguments.name: blog_tag_ids
arguments.description: A list of strings representing the IDs of the Blog Tag objects to retrieve.

arguments.name: include_deleted_tags
arguments.description: Boolean indicating if deleted Blog Tags should be included in the response. If true, deleted tags are returned.

api_endpoints.summary: Retrieve a batch of Blog Tags
api_endpoints.description: Retrieve the Blog Tag objects identified in the request body.

query.name: archived

value_schema.description: Specifies whether to return deleted Blog Tags. Defaults to `false`.

query.description: Specifies whether to return deleted Blog Tags. Defaults to `false`.

body.name: inputs

value_schema.description: Strings to input.

body.description: Strings to input.

json_schema.description: Strings to input.

api_endpoints.name: get-/cms/v3/blogs/tags_getPage

wrapper_tool.name: get_blog_tags

description.tagline: Retrieve a list of blog tags with paging and filtering options.
description.detailed: This tool fetches the list of blog tags, supporting paging and filtering. It is useful for integrations that need to access blog tags for analysis or editing suggestions.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: List of blog tags with pagination support.

arguments.name: filter_by_creation_time
arguments.description: Filter blog tags to return only those created at the specified exact time. Use ISO 8601 format for the date-time.

arguments.name: created_after_time
arguments.description: Only return Blog Tags created after the specified time. Provide the time in ISO 8601 format.

arguments.name: filter_tags_created_before
arguments.description: Only return blog tags created before the specified date and time in UTC, formatted as an ISO 8601 string.

arguments.name: updated_at_exact
arguments.description: Return blog tags last updated at the specified exact time (ISO 8601 format).

arguments.name: updated_after
arguments.description: Return Blog Tags last updated after the specified date and time. Provide in ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2023-10-21T15:30:00Z'.

arguments.name: last_updated_before
arguments.description: Return blog tags updated before this date and time (in ISO 8601 format).

arguments.name: sort_fields_for_results
arguments.description: Fields to sort results by. Options: `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. Default is `createdAt`.

arguments.name: pagination_cursor_token
arguments.description: The token to retrieve the next set of results from a paginated response. Obtain this from the `paging.next.after` property in the previous response.

arguments.name: maximum_results_to_return
arguments.description: Specify the maximum number of blog tags to return. Default is 100.

arguments.name: additional_properties
arguments.description: Include additional fields in the response. Specify the properties you want to retrieve.

arguments.name: include_archived_tags
arguments.description: Specify whether to return deleted blog tags. Defaults to false.

api_endpoints.description: Get the list of blog tags. Supports paging and filtering. This method would be useful for an integration that examined these models and used an external service to suggest edits.

query.name: createdAt

value_schema.description: Only return Blog Tags created at exactly the specified time.

query.description: Only return Blog Tags created at exactly the specified time.

query.name: createdAfter

value_schema.description: Only return Blog Tags created after the specified time.

query.description: Only return Blog Tags created after the specified time.

query.name: createdBefore

value_schema.description: Only return Blog Tags created before the specified time.

query.description: Only return Blog Tags created before the specified time.

query.name: updatedAt

value_schema.description: Only return Blog Tags last updated at exactly the specified time.

query.description: Only return Blog Tags last updated at exactly the specified time.

query.name: updatedAfter

value_schema.description: Only return Blog Tags last updated after the specified time.

query.description: Only return Blog Tags last updated after the specified time.

query.name: updatedBefore

value_schema.description: Only return Blog Tags last updated before the specified time.

query.description: Only return Blog Tags last updated before the specified time.

query.name: sort

value_schema.description: Specifies which fields to use for sorting results. Valid fields are `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. `createdAt` will be used by default.

query.description: Specifies which fields to use for sorting results. Valid fields are `name`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`. `createdAt` will be used by default.

value_schema.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

api_endpoints.name: post-/cms/v3/blogs/tags_create

wrapper_tool.name: create_blog_tag

description.tagline: Create a new blog tag in HubSpot CMS.
description.detailed: This tool creates a new tag for a blog in the HubSpot CMS. It should be called when there's a need to categorize or organize content within the blog by creating new tags.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of blog tag creation status.

arguments.name: deletion_timestamp
arguments.description: The ISO8601 timestamp marking when the blog tag was deleted.

arguments.name: creation_timestamp
arguments.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when this Blog Tag was created. Leave empty if not applicable.

arguments.name: tag_name
arguments.description: The name for the new blog tag to be created in HubSpot CMS.

arguments.name: language_code
arguments.description: The explicit ISO 639 language code for the tag, such as 'en' for English or 'es' for Spanish.

arguments.name: blog_tag_unique_id
arguments.description: The unique ID assigned to the Blog Tag.

arguments.name: primary_tag_translation_id
arguments.description: Specify the ID of the primary tag that this tag was translated from.

arguments.name: updated_timestamp
arguments.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when the Blog Tag was last updated.

api_endpoints.description: Create a new Blog Tag.

body.name: deletedAt

value_schema.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when this Blog Tag was deleted.

body.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when this Blog Tag was deleted.

json_schema.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when this Blog Tag was deleted.

body.name: name

value_schema.description: The name of the tag.

body.description: The name of the tag.

json_schema.description: The name of the tag.

body.name: language

value_schema.description: The explicitly defined ISO 639 language code of the tag.

body.description: The explicitly defined ISO 639 language code of the tag.

json_schema.description: The explicitly defined ISO 639 language code of the tag.

body.name: id

value_schema.description: The unique ID of the Blog Tag.

body.description: The unique ID of the Blog Tag.

json_schema.description: The unique ID of the Blog Tag.

body.name: translatedFromId

value_schema.description: ID of the primary tag this object was translated from.

body.description: ID of the primary tag this object was translated from.

json_schema.description: ID of the primary tag this object was translated from.

wrapper_tool.name: attach_tag_to_language_group

description.tagline: Attach a blog tag to a multi-language group.
description.detailed: Use this tool to connect a specific blog tag to a designated multi-language group within HubSpot CMS. This is useful for managing tags across different language versions of a blog.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of tag attachment to language group.

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_blog_tag_by_id

description.tagline: Retrieve blog tag details using its ID.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get information about a blog tag by providing its unique ID. Call this tool when you need details about a specific blog tag in the HubSpot CMS.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of the specified blog tag.

arguments.name: blog_tag_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the Blog Tag to be retrieved.

arguments.name: property_name
arguments.description: Specify a property of the blog tag to retrieve. Leave blank to get all details.

arguments.name: include_archived_blog_tags
arguments.description: Specify whether to include archived blog tags in the response. Defaults to `false`.

description.detailed: Use this tool to delete a specific Blog Tag in the HubSpot CMS by providing the object's ID. This is useful for managing and organizing blog content within the CMS.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of blog tag deletion.

arguments.name: blog_tag_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the Blog Tag to be deleted.

arguments.name: return_only_archived_results
arguments.description: Set to true to return only blog tags that have been archived.

api_endpoints.name: patch-/cms/v3/blogs/tags/{objectId}_update

wrapper_tool.name: update_blog_tag

description.tagline: Update specific fields of a blog tag by its ID.
description.detailed: This tool updates specific fields of a single blog tag identified by its object ID. It enables partial updates, allowing changes to only the specified fields.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of blog tag update.

arguments.name: blog_tag_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the blog tag to be updated.

arguments.name: deleted_timestamp
arguments.description: The ISO8601 timestamp indicating when the blog tag was deleted.

arguments.name: created_timestamp
arguments.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when the blog tag was created. This field is optional and can be used if the creation time needs to be updated.

arguments.name: tag_name
arguments.description: The new name for the blog tag to be updated. This is a required field when changing the tag's name.

arguments.name: language
arguments.description: The ISO 639 language code for the tag. Select from the available options.

arguments.name: blog_tag_unique_id
arguments.description: The unique ID of the Blog Tag to be updated.

arguments.name: primary_tag_translated_from_id
arguments.description: ID of the primary tag from which this tag was translated.

arguments.name: last_updated_timestamp
arguments.description: The ISO8601 timestamp when the blog tag was last updated.

arguments.name: update_deleted_blog_tags
arguments.description: Set to `true` to update deleted Blog Tags. Defaults to `false`.

api_endpoints.description:
Sparse updates a single Blog Tag object identified by the id in the path.
All the column values need not be specified. Only the that need to be modified can be specified.

api_endpoints.name: get-/cms/v3/url-redirects/_getPage

wrapper_tool.name: fetch_url_redirects

description.tagline: Retrieve all URL redirects with optional filters.
description.detailed: Use this tool to access a list of all existing URL redirects in the HubSpot CMS. You can apply filters based on creation or updated date to narrow down the results.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: List of existing URL redirects with filters applied.

arguments.name: created_at
arguments.description: Return redirects created exactly on this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

arguments.name: created_after_date
arguments.description: Return redirects created after this date (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

arguments.name: filter_created_before_date
arguments.description: Return redirects created before this date. Expected format: YYYY-MM-DD.

arguments.name: filter_by_exact_update_date
arguments.description: Return redirects last updated on this exact date. Use a valid date format (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD).

arguments.name: filter_updated_after
arguments.description: Only include redirects updated after this specified date (ISO 8601 format).

arguments.name: updated_before_date
arguments.description: Only return redirects last updated before this date (in YYYY-MM-DD format).

arguments.name: sort_criteria
arguments.description: Specify fields to sort the URL redirects by. Can include multiple fields such as 'createdAt' or 'updatedAt'.

arguments.name: paging_cursor_token
arguments.description: Token for the last read resource to fetch additional results.

arguments.name: results_per_page_limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of URL redirects to return per page. Use to control pagination.

arguments.name: return_archived_only
arguments.description: Set to true to return only archived URL redirects, false to exclude them.

api_endpoints.description: Returns all existing URL redirects. Results can be limited and filtered by creation or updated date.

query.name: createdAt

value_schema.description: Only return redirects created on exactly this date.

query.description: Only return redirects created on exactly this date.

query.name: createdAfter

value_schema.description: Only return redirects created after this date.

query.description: Only return redirects created after this date.

query.name: createdBefore

value_schema.description: Only return redirects created before this date.

query.description: Only return redirects created before this date.

query.name: updatedAt

value_schema.description: Only return redirects last updated on exactly this date.

query.description: Only return redirects last updated on exactly this date.

query.name: updatedAfter

value_schema.description: Only return redirects last updated after this date.

query.description: Only return redirects last updated after this date.

query.name: updatedBefore

value_schema.description: Only return redirects last updated before this date.

query.description: Only return redirects last updated before this date.

query.name: after

value_schema.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

query.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

query.name: limit

value_schema.description: Maximum number of result per page

query.description: Maximum number of result per page

query.name: archived

value_schema.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

query.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

api_endpoints.name: post-/cms/v3/url-redirects/_create

wrapper_tool.name: create_url_redirect

description.tagline: Creates and configures a new URL redirect in HubSpot CMS.
description.detailed: Use this tool to create and set up a new URL redirect within the HubSpot CMS. Ideal for managing website redirects effectively.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of the new URL redirect creation.

arguments.name: redirect_style
arguments.description: Integer indicating the style of the redirect. Defines the behavior and type of the redirect, such as permanent (301) or temporary (302).

arguments.name: route_prefix
arguments.description: Defines the prefix for the URL route to be redirected. Provide the specific path without the domain, e.g., '/example-path'.

arguments.name: redirect_destination_url
arguments.description: The target URL to which the redirect will point. This should be a valid and complete URL.

arguments.name: redirect_precedence
arguments.description: An integer indicating the priority of the redirect if multiple rules match. Higher numbers take precedence.

arguments.name: ignore_trailing_slash
arguments.description: Set to true to ignore trailing slashes, allowing flexibility in URL matches.

arguments.name: match_query_string
arguments.description: Indicates whether the redirect should match the query string. Set to true to match, false to ignore.

arguments.name: match_full_url
arguments.description: Set to true to match the entire URL exactly. False applies partial matching.

arguments.name: enable_protocol_agnostic
arguments.description: Set to true to ignore the protocol (HTTP/HTTPS) when matching URLs. Enables protocol-agnostic redirects.

arguments.name: apply_only_after_not_found
arguments.description: Applies the redirect only after a 404 Not Found response if true.

arguments.name: enable_pattern_matching
arguments.description: Set to true to enable URL pattern matching for the redirect. False matches exact URLs only.

api_endpoints.description: Creates and configures a new URL redirect.

wrapper_tool.name: update_url_redirect_settings

description.tagline: Update settings for an existing URL redirect in HubSpot CMS.
description.detailed: This tool updates the configuration of a specified URL redirect in HubSpot CMS. Use it when you need to change the destination or other settings of an existing URL redirect.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of URL redirect settings update.

arguments.name: url_redirect_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the URL redirect to be updated. This ID specifies which redirect's settings will be modified.

arguments.name: url_redirect_settings
arguments.description: JSON object defining the URL redirect settings, including destination URL, redirect style, and matching criteria.

api_endpoints.description: Updates the settings for an existing URL redirect.

isTrailingSlashOptional.description: Whether a trailing slash will be ignored.

redirectStyle.description: The type of redirect to create. Options include: 301 (permanent), 302 (temporary), or 305 (proxy). Find more details [here](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/cos-general/how-to-redirect-a-hubspot-page).

isMatchQueryString.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match on the entire URL path, including the query string.

isMatchFullUrl.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match on the entire URL, including the domain.

destination.description: The destination URL, where the target URL should be redirected if it matches the `routePrefix`.

isOnlyAfterNotFound.description: Whether the URL redirect mapping should apply only if a live page on the URL isn't found. If False, the URL redirect mapping will take precedence over any existing page.

isPattern.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match based on pattern.

precedence.description: Used to prioritize URL redirection. If a given URL matches more than one redirect, the one with the **lower** precedence will be used.

routePrefix.description: The target incoming URL, path, or pattern to match for redirection.

isProtocolAgnostic.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match both HTTP and HTTPS protocols.

id.description: The unique ID of this URL redirect.
